page.title: 12POLITICS, RUGELEY
page.content: Rugeley is a small industrial and market town in rural Staffordshire. The political representation is mixed. Someone living in Rugeley may be represented by all 3 major political parties. In 1985, the Member of Parliament is Conservative; the constituency includes Lichfield and Tamworth and the surrounding areas. Members of all 3 parties represent Rugeley on Staffordshire County Council. When Rugeley was a separate Urban District Council, it was mainly Labour but now Liberals hold the majority of seats in the town. Cannock Chase District Council consists of Rugeley and Cannock together, the majority party is Labour. The district council meets in Cannock and there is a feeling that Rugeley is deprived compared with Cannock which seems to have more new amenities.
